Project name

treeSortR

A new package for CRAN, appropriately named treeSortR, provides a set of S3/S4 functions extending the classical phylogenomics R package APE, that manages sorting trees based on the following parameters: target groups, minimum bootstrap threshold, relative query proportion, absolute query proportion and species or target groups in a clade with a command-line interface. Furthermore, treeSortR operates on simple but powerful data structures while installation and use depends exclusively on R and the APE package.

Download

-i,-j, Target Groups

Target group taxa to find within putative monophyletic clade. Must be enclosed in double quotes. Release <=1.0 will accommodate two target groups and character string must match target group exactly (e.g. capitalizations and other symbols)

- d Folder

Directory to specify where trees are located. When the directory is pointed, the directory which contains tSR does not need to contain a folder of trees. Must begin with ~/ and enclosed in double quotes.

-e Bootstrap threshold

Bootstrap threshold to select out trees.
